intro: Hesperethusa villosa, commonly known as the hairy hesperethusa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hesperethusa villosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
